Package it.polimi.ingsw.Model

Class DefaultTurn

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.Model.DefaultTurn
All Implemented Interfaces:
Turn
Direct Known Subclasses:
ArtemisTurn, AthenaTurn, DemeterTurn, HephaestusTurn, PrometheusTurn
public class DefaultTurn
extends java.lang.Object
implements Turn
Represents Player's turn in case the game is without cards

  • Method Details

    • start

      public void start​(Worker worker)
      Start the turn by setting the Worker you want to play with. It's the first method to be invoked to perform any other action within the turn.
      Specified by:
      start in interface Turn
      Parameters:
      worker - you want to play with

    • move

      public void move​(int x, int y) throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException, java.lang.NullPointerException, CantGoUpException, InvalidMoveException
      Move the chosen Worker into the specified coordinates. It calls Move.move(Worker, int x, int y) or Move.moveNoGoUp(Worker, int x, int y) using moveAction
      Specified by:
      move in interface Turn
      Parameters:
      x - coordinate for the board
      y - coordinate for the board
      Throws:
      java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if chosen coordinates go outside the board limits
      java.lang.NullPointerException - if you try to move a worker that has null reference
      CantGoUpException - if you try to level up but you can't
      InvalidMoveException - if chosen coordinates are already occupied by another player

    • build

      public void build​(int x, int y) throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException, java.lang.NullPointerException, InvalidBuildException
      Build into the specified coordinates. It calls Build.build(Worker, int x, int y) using buildAction
      Specified by:
      build in interface Turn
      Parameters:
      x - coordinate for the board
      y - coordinate for the board
      Throws:
      java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if chosen coordinates go outside the board limits
      java.lang.NullPointerException - if you try to move a worker that has null reference
      InvalidBuildException - if you try to build too far from Worker position or into a box containing a DOME

    • buildDome

      public void buildDome​(int x, int y) throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException, java.lang.NullPointerException, InvalidBuildException
      Builds a dome into the specified coordinates. It calls AtlasBuild.buildDome(Worker, int x, int y) using buildAction
      Specified by:
      buildDome in interface Turn
      Parameters:
      x - coordinate for the board
      y - coordinate for the board
      Throws:

      java.lang.NullPointerException - if you try to move a worker that has null reference
      InvalidBuildException - if you try to build too far from Worker position or into a box containing a DOME
